intro: Lathyrus sericeus, commonly known as silky vetch, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm. The plant features slender, hairy stems and trifoliate leaves composed of three oval-shaped leaflets. Its flowers are small, pea-like, and usually pink or purple in color, appearing in clusters. Lathyrus sericeus is often found in grasslands, woodland edges, and disturbed soils, and it plays a role in supporting pollinators.
